title: ctest compiled with gcc 10 seg faults
body:
<!-- Explain, in a clear and concise way, the command you ran and the result you were trying to achieve.
Example: "I ran `spack find` to list all the installed packages and ..." -->

ctest from cmake 3.17.1 compiled from recent spack development versions will segmentation fault when compiled with GCC 10.1.0. These are the latest cmake and gcc versions supported by spack.

I have never had this problem with other compilers and suspect a subtle compatibility problem. Note that cmake itself seemingly works without problems.

If would be very helpful to know if someone else can reproduce the issue.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ mkdir empty_directory; cd empty_directory
$ spack load cmake@3.17.1%gcc@10.1.0
$ ctest -version
ctest version 3.17.1

CMake suite maintained and supported by Kitware (kitware.com/cmake).
$ ctest -R my_unit_test
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
$ spack spec cmake@3.17.1%gcc@10.1.0
Input spec
--------------------------------
cmake@3.17.1%gcc@10.1.0

Concretized
--------------------------------
cmake@3.17.1%gcc@10.1.0~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt patches=1c540040c7e203dd8e27aa20345ecb07fe06570d56410a24a266ae570b1c4c39 arch=linux-rhel8-cascadelake
    ^ncurses@6.2%gcc@10.1.0~symlinks+termlib arch=linux-rhel8-cascadelake
        ^pkgconf@1.6.3%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-rhel8-cascadelake
    ^openssl@1.1.1g%gcc@10.1.0+systemcerts arch=linux-rhel8-cascadelake
        ^perl@5.30.2%gcc@10.1.0+cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-rhel8-cascadelake
            ^gdbm@1.18.1%gcc@10.1.0 patches=7f569b9287e9e5a4236636eef32ff3428f0462ec17aea359e0ebee07649f1f16 arch=linux-rhel8-cascadelake
                ^readline@8.0%gcc@10.1.0 arch=linux-rhel8-cascadelake
        ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@10.1.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-rhel8-cascadelake

$ cd ~/apps/spack; git log|head -5
commit 31ccf80294382a391743728a736574737217c23b
Author: vvolkl <valentin.volkl@cern.ch>
Date:   Tue May 19 04:52:18 2020 +0200

    [podio] fix root cxxstd dependency (#16708)
```



### Error Message

<!-- If Spack reported an error, provide the error message. If it did not report an error but the output appears incorrect, provide the incorrect output. If there was no error message and no output but the result is incorrect, describe how it does not match what you expect. -->
Segfault as shown above. This error is from ctest and not spack.

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
```
* **Spack:** 0.14.2-1163-31ccf8029
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-rhel8-cascadelake
```
